meanings.definition: A horse harnessed closest to the wheels of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The wheelhorses pulled the carriage smoothly along the road.
meanings.sent2: The farmer always took good care of his trusty wheelhorses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to ride one of the wheelhorses in the stable!
meanings.sent4: In the race of life, she was the dependable wheelhorse that kept the family moving forward.
meanings.sent5: The image of the majestic wheelhorses stayed etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is crucial to the functioning or success of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: She was the wheelhorse of the team, always leading by example.
meanings.sent2: The dedicated teacher was the wheelhorse of the school's academic programs.
meanings.sent3: The coffee machine, the unsung wheelhorse of the office, never got a break!
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas acted as the wheelhorses that drove the company's growth.
meanings.sent5: The CEO recognized her as the invaluable wheelhorse in the company's success.
